title: Gladiator
data:
The **Gladiator** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and is based on [a role idea](/wiki/User:Fyr/YANI/Gladiator "User:Fyr/YANI/Gladiator") created by [Fyr](/wiki/User:Fyr "User:Fyr").

Gladiators can be a human, dwarf, orc, ogre or giant of any alignment.

[Guidebook](/wiki/Guidebook "Guidebook") entry: Gladiators are professional fighters, trained and equipped to combat ferocious beasts and one another as a form of entertainment.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [3 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [4 Prize money](#Prize_money)
- [5 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [6 Skills](#Skills)
- [7 Gladiator Quest](#Gladiator_Quest)

## Starting equipment

- a +1 [silver spear](/wiki/Silver_spear "Silver spear")
- a +0 [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection")
- a [cram rations](/wiki/Cram_ration "Cram ration")

## Intrinsics

- Exp Level 3: [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")
- Exp Level 6: [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")
- Exp Level 10: [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster")
- Exp Level 15: [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")

## Techniques

At [XL](/wiki/XL "XL") 3, gladiators learn how to [shield block](/wiki/Shield_block "Shield block").

## Prize money

If your alignment is non-negative, killing any [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") that starts out as [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile") (i.e., when such killing is not [murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder")), dog, [jackal](/wiki/Jackal "Jackal"), [wolf](/wiki/Wolf "Wolf"), [lynx](/wiki/Lynx "Lynx"), [panther](/wiki/Panther "Panther"), [tiger](/wiki/Tiger "Tiger"), [mumak](/wiki/Mumak "Mumak"), or [mastodon](/wiki/Mastodon "Mastodon") adds 50+(1d20\*XL) zorkmids to your inventory. (These types of animals would be hunted and killed in the arena for the amusement of the spectators.)

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level. The names are taken from gladiatorial styles, and when using weapons appropriate to their current rank (indicated in parentheses), gladiators receive a +4 to hit bonus and, if Unskilled, hit as if at Basic proficiency.

- XL 1-2: Velite (spear, sling)
- XL 3-5: Thraex (scimitar)
- XL 6-9: Dimachaerus (two-weapon, longsword)
- XL 10-13: Venator (polearms)
- XL 14-17: Murmillo (short sword)
- XL 18-21: Hoplomachus (short sword, javelin)
- XL 22-25: Retiarius (trident, dagger)
- XL 26-29: Secutor (longsword)
- XL 30: Centurion (two-weapon, longsword, saber)

## Skills

Gladiators start with Basic skill in saber and bare handed combat. The gladiator's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [cause fear](/wiki/Cause_fear "Cause fear").

The entire arena is always affected by [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict") which cannot be turned off.

Gladiator

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Gladiator is a role that appears in SlashTHEM, and is based on a role idea created by Fyr.

Gladiators can be a human, dwarf, orc, ogre or giant of any alignment.

Guidebook entry: Gladiators are professional fighters, trained and equipped to combat ferocious beasts and one another as a form of entertainment.

Contents

  • 1 Starting equipment
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Techniques
  • 4 Prize money
  • 5 Rank titles
  • 6 Skills
  • 7 Gladiator Quest

Starting equipment

  • a +1 silver spear
  • a +0 shield of reflection
  • a cram rations

Intrinsics

  • Exp Level 3: speed
  • Exp Level 6: stealth
  • Exp Level 10: aggravate monster
  • Exp Level 15: warning

Techniques

At XL 3, gladiators learn how to shield block.

Prize money

If your alignment is non-negative, killing any human that starts out as hostile (i.e., when such killing is not murder), dog, jackal, wolf, lynx, panther, tiger, mumak, or mastodon adds 50+(1d20*XL) zorkmids to your inventory. (These types of animals would be hunted and killed in the arena for the amusement of the spectators.)

Rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level. The names are taken from gladiatorial styles, and when using weapons appropriate to their current rank (indicated in parentheses), gladiators receive a +4 to hit bonus and, if Unskilled, hit as if at Basic proficiency.

  • XL 1-2: Velite (spear, sling)
  • XL 3-5: Thraex (scimitar)
  • XL 6-9: Dimachaerus (two-weapon, longsword)
  • XL 10-13: Venator (polearms)
  • XL 14-17: Murmillo (short sword)
  • XL 18-21: Hoplomachus (short sword, javelin)
  • XL 22-25: Retiarius (trident, dagger)
  • XL 26-29: Secutor (longsword)
  • XL 30: Centurion (two-weapon, longsword, saber)

Skills

Valkyrie skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: pick-axe, crossbow
Skilled
  • Weapons: saber, knife, javelin, polearms, scimitar, flail, broadsword, two-handed sword, morning star, hammer, lance, whip
  • Combat: riding
Expert
  • Weapons: unicorn horn, long sword, short sword, dagger, spear, trident
  • Combat: two-weapon combat
  • Spells: attack, body

Gladiators start with Basic skill in saber and bare handed combat. The gladiator's special spell is cause fear.

Gladiator Quest

The Champion of Pompeji:

  • can fly.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
Reference monst.c, line 7074

The gladiator's quest leader is Tutor (a homunculus whose dialogue is humorously modeled after Burgess Meredith's role in the film "Rocky" as fight trainer Micky Goldmill).

The quest sees you fighting the Champion of Pompeji for the Imperial Token, an artifact gold ring. When worn, the Token has whatever randomized effect gold rings have in your game. In addition, when carried, it conveys drain resistance and hungerless regeneration. For Gladiators only, #invoking it acts as the “aggravate monster” monster spell (wakes up all monsters on the level and has a one-fifth chance of unparalyzing paralyzed monsters on the level, with the message: "You feel that monsters are aware of your presence.").

The quest goal level is the Colosseum, a large circular arena populated with several werecreatures and "prize money" animals (as listed above). The entire arena is always affected by conflict which cannot be turned off.
